predicate.note: Frames file for 'transport' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 11.1-1.

roleset.name: move from one place to another

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Consolidated Rail Corp. said it would spend more than $30 million on 1,000 enclosed railcars for *trace* transporting autos.

example.name: with destination
example.text: But Brooks declined, *trace* figuring that *trace* transporting the mucked up money to Washington would cost the company thousands more.

example.name: with source and destination
example.text: Foothills Pipe Lines Ltd. filed an application with Canadian regulators to build a 4.4 billion Canadian dollar (US$ 3.74 billion) pipeline *trace* to transport natural gas from Canada's Arctic to U.S. markets beginning in...
example.arg: *trace* -> a 4.4 billion Canadian dollar (US$ 3.74 billion) pipeline
